page.title: 13 Dusk Chillington 1985
page.content: I ran to the ducks with bread in my hands. I saw a man with old wrinkled hands. He was feeding the ducks all alone. I ran to the man with the old wrinkled hands and talked about lambs and we looked at the land. I saw the fields with the sunset behind them and then I saw the ducklings. I saw ducks awake and some ducks asleep and some ducklings following their mother. The old man had gone home, and I was all alone Then it started to get misty. It was a lush pink colour and it was as though I was in charmed land.
